title: Table Schema: Mss5515M26_01 & Mss5515M26_02
description: This schema describes the structure of the datasets Mss5515M26_01 & Mss5515M26_02

properties.name: sort_id
properties.title: Sort ID
properties.description: A numerical ID to allow sorting of rows while preserving the data's context and original order.

properties.name: druckenbrod_sort_id
properties.title: Druckenbrod Sort ID
properties.description: The numerical ID produced by Daniel Druckenbrod, et al. in their dataset to allow sorting while preserving the dataâ€™s context.
properties.context: Where absent, previously subsumed temperature comments were reformatted into individual rows.

properties.name: key
properties.title: Key
properties.description: Primary key assigned at APS to each row as a unique identifier, comprising file name and transaction number.

properties.name: aps_call_number
properties.title: APS call number
properties.description: The APS call number of the physical manuscript object from which this data is derived.

properties.name: file_name
properties.title: File name
properties.description: The local APS file name of the imaged representative manuscript page from which this data is derived.

properties.name: transaction_number_on_this_page
properties.title: Transaction number on this page
properties.description: The ordinal position of the entry row within a page (beginning at 1) from which this data is derived.

properties.name: aps_digital_library_page_image_url
properties.title: APS Digital Library page image URL
properties.description: The URL where the representative image of the manuscript page, from which this data is derived, may be found in the APS Digital Library.

properties.name: aps_notes
properties.title: APS notes
properties.description: Contextual notes made at APS during the data cleaning process to document data choices and interpretive discoveries.
properties.context: This column primarily indicates data choices regarding missing, null, reformatted, edited, or added data points.

properties.name: druckenbrod_notes
properties.title: Druckenbrod notes
properties.description: Transcription notes added by Druckenbrod et al.
properties.context: This data was orignally contained under the column heading 'More info comment'.

properties.name: date_of_entry
properties.title: Date of entry
properties.description: The date of the initial entry in the manuscript volume, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD.

properties.name: time_of_entry_as_transcribed
properties.title: Time of entry as transcribed
properties.description: The time of the entry recorded in the manuscript.
properties.context: While this is most often 'sunrise' or '4:00 PM', as these are the columns for which the Madisons recorded meteorological data throughout the manuscript, they also added '2:00 PM' starting in 1788-06-16. Furthermore, because the manuscript indicates that some entries were taken later or earlier than their column headings outline, those specifications have also been transcribed in this column.

properties.name: time_of_entry_standardized
properties.title: Time of entry standardized
properties.description: The time of the data's entry, standardized to ISO 1861.
properties.context: Any instance of sunrise in Time Transcribed is assumed to correspond with sunrise time marked in Virginia almanacs. The St. George Tucker almanacs are referenced for the sunrise time data. The almanacs are part of the Tucker-Coleman Papers at the William and Mary Special Collections Research Center, and are accessed through their Digital Archive. The 1788 and 1789 almanacs are missing in the WMSPRC Digital Archive and those corresponding data points are left blank in Time Transcribed.

properties.name: wind_direction_as_transcribed
properties.title: Wind direction as transcribed
properties.description: The wind direction as noted in the manuscript.
properties.context: Many later wind directions in the manuscript show several letters on different levels in the same box, which has been transcribed with a '/' mark (e.g., 'NE' on top of 'NW' has been transcribed as 'NE/NW').

properties.name: wind_direction_standardized
properties.title: Wind direction standardized
properties.description: The wind direction as transcribed, converted into standardized three-letter compass notation for machine readability and interoperability.
properties.context: Where it can be reasonably assumed that the transcription refers to a recognized compass direction (e.g., 'SW veering to S' referring to SSW), the wind direction is formatted in that notation; for example, 'NE by N,' 'S.SW,' etc. and similar variations on compass directions. However, some noted wind directions (e.g., 'veering and unsettled') present no quantitative data on wind direction, and thus have been excluded from this column and noted as 'null data in wind direction' in the APS notes column. Additionally, partway through this volume, the Madisons abandoned most variations on compass directions in favor of noting two-to-four letters split into two levels within the manuscript (e.g., 'NE/NW,' 'S/SW'). Because these notations often indicate distinct directions as well as regular directions, I have counted them as null data for this column, and left blanks in this column where the transcription includes a '/'.

properties.name: temperature_fahrenheit_as_transcribed
properties.title: Temperature (Fahrenheit) as transcribed
properties.description: The F temperature in the manuscript as transcribed.
properties.context: Any temperature when it is not directly transcribed is recorded to the tenths place in Fahrenheit and any presence of '999' in the temperature data was replaced with a blank data point.

properties.name: temperature_fahrenheit_standardized
properties.title: Temperature (Fahrenheit) standardized
properties.description: The F temperature in the manuscript as standardized into a decimal-number format.

properties.name: daily_temp_high_fahrenheit_as_transcribed
properties.title: Daily temp high (Fahrenheit) as transcribed
properties.description: The F temperature originally recorded under the 'Greatest Heat' column in the manuscript.

properties.name: temp_high_entry_time_as_transcribed
properties.title: Temp high entry time as transcribed
properties.description: The local time at which the F temperature recorded under 'Greatest Heat' was noted in the manuscript.

properties.name: temp_high_entry_time_standardized
properties.title: Temp high entry time standardized
properties.description: The time of the data's entry, standardized to ISO 1861.

properties.name: precipitation_time
properties.title: Precipitation time
properties.description: The time of day of precipitation event as recorded by Daniel Druckenbrod, et al.

properties.name: precipitation_type
properties.title: Precipitation type
properties.description: The type of precipitation event as recorded by Daniel Druckenbrod, et al.

properties.name: precipitation_measurement_inches
properties.title: Precipitation measurement (inches)
properties.description: The amount, in inches, of precipitation as recorded by Daniel Druckenbrod, et al.
properties.context: Precipitation amount is recorded to tenth of an inch.

properties.name: observer
properties.title: Observer
properties.description: Data observer as recorded by Druckenbrod et al. Where Madison was not the presumed author, data point is blank.
properties.context: This column is included to represent the data recorded by Druckenbrod et al., and may not correspond to historical fact. We can assume that James Madison, Jr. (1751-1836) or James Madison, Sr. (1723-1801) recorded the vast majority of this data, but at the time of data cleaning, not enough information was available to discern between the records of individual entries.

properties.name: meteorological_observations_as_transcribed
properties.title: Meteorological observations as transcribed
properties.description: Meteorological observations as transcribed from the manuscript, generally consisting of comments written in the manuscriptâ€™s 'weather at sunrise' and 'weather at 4:00 PM' columns.
properties.context: Specific conditions noted in this column are indicated in the boolean columns that follow. Any additional temperature recordings in the Meteorological Transcriptions section (e.g.: 77 at 5 Oâ€™Clock) are moved to APS Notes. If the extra temperature comment is lengthy, it is moved to Other Observations and the change is noted in APS Notes. When a note on plant growth includes various dates (ie: April 10 planted peas 25 peas blossoming 29 first peas at the table [all written in for April 10]), the relevant information is redistributed to each date (e.g.: relevant note moved to April 10, 25, and 29). The division and originating date (e.g.: April 10) is recorded in APS Notes.

properties.name: other_observations_transcribed
properties.title: Other observations transcribed
properties.description: Other observations transcribed from the manuscript, generally located there under 'shooting or falling of leaves of trees, flowers, other remarkable plants,' 'appearance or disappearance of birds,' and 'miscellanea.' The specific nature of these observations is often noted by the previous columns, although observations regarding human activity (such as 'barbacue') also appear occasionally.
